casebody.data:
BRAZIEL v. UNITED STATES.* (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. December 18, 1916.) No. 2943. In Error to the District Court of the United States for the Northern District of Texas; Edward R. Meek, Judge. Guy H. Sigler, of Ardmore. Okl., for plaintiff in error. James C. Wilson, U. S. Atty., and William E. Allen, Asst. U. S. Atty., both of Dallas, Tex.

Before PARDEE and WALKER, Circuit Judges, and FOSTER, District Judge.

Rehearing denied February 27, 1917.

 PER CURIAM.

We find no error in the rulings in the trial of this case, and the evidence fully warranted the verdict found. Judgment affirmed.
